topic.title: Undergraduate GIS Job Opportunity – Apply Now!
topic.text:
Dear Students,

I want to share a great on-campus opportunity with you. The Geoplan Center in the Department of Urban and Regional Planning is hiring students for a part-time GIS job. Dr. Bejleri leads a team that works on GIS research in transportation safety and visual simulation. This role is also available as an internship.

Job Duties:

  • Conduct geocoding of traffic crashes in Florida.
  • Process and review GIS transportation data.
  • Use a web-based GIS system (you will receive training).

Job Requirements:

  • You should have taken or be taking a GIS course.
  • You must be patient, self-disciplined, curious, and careful with details.
  • If you have another job, you must be willing to work only in this position.
  • You need a computer (laptop or desktop) and a stable internet connection.
  • You must attend weekly meetings and respond to emails quickly.
  • You should be able to work independently.

Job Details:

  • Pay: $13 per hour.
  • Hours: 10-20 hours per week (more hours are preferred in summer).
  • Work Mode: You can work remotely.
  • Duration: You must be available from now through the end of Spring 2026, with a chance to extend through Summer 2026 and possibly beyond.

How to Apply: Create one PDF file that includes the following:

  1. Cover Letter:

    • Explain why you are interested in the position.
    • Describe your skills and why you are a good fit.
    • State your desired start date (immediate start is best) and your availability through Spring 2026.
    • List the number of hours you can work each week (up to 20) and how you plan to manage your schedule this year (Spring, Summer, and Fall).
    • Share your expected school workload (number of credits) for each term.
    • For SBE students: let us know if you have chosen your capstone topic or are still deciding.
    • Provide your expected graduation date.
    • Mention any previous work at UF, including the type of work and the time period.
    • Include your current GPA and major.

  2. Current Resume

Submission Instructions:
Send your application to Dr. Xu at axuxinjing@ufl.edu with the subject line “Application for GIS job.” Please submit your application by midnight on February 28, 2025.

This is a great chance to gain hands-on experience in GIS work while applying your classroom skills to real-world projects. If you have any questions see the attached PDF and please feel free to reach out to Dr. Xu via email.

Best of luck to all of you.
